page.title: 02FARMING:DARTMOUTH ESTATES.
page.content: Over half of the farming land in the block is owned by the ninth Earl of Dartmouth whose ancestor acquired it by marriage around 1720.The Dartmouth Estate has 3500 acres mostly to the south of the A640 Rochdale to Halifax road and extending into the next block south.The Water Authority owns about one sixth of the land while the rest is in private hands or is moorland;- unsuitable for viable farming. Lord Dartmouth rents his land to tenants who, through historical circumstance, own the buildings.These rents depend on the quality of the property's grassland.The tenants hold a 'Candlemas Tenancy' which expires on February 2nd.Rent increases are based on land values and the profitability of the acreage.EEC.quotas which limit production have led to a 'nil-growth' period in dairy farming.
